member.name: T:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeIncludeSetting
member.summary: Defines the style of include to use when serializing attributes

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeIncludeSetting.All
member.summary: All attributes are serialized

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeIncludeSetting.BlackList
member.summary: Attributes are serialized as long as they dont exist in the constructor blacklist

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeIncludeSetting.WhiteList
member.summary: Attributes are only serialized if the type exists in the whitelist

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeIncludeSetting.None
member.summary: All attributes are skipped during serialization

member.name: T:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeMatchSetting
member.summary: Specifies how attributes should be matched to the whitelist/blacklist for inclusion

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeMatchSetting.Equality
member.summary: Uses == on the type

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeMatchSetting.Name
member.summary: Matches based on type name only

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeMatchSetting.AssemblyQualifiedName
member.summary: Matches based on AssemblyQualifiedName

member.name: F:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.AttributeMatchSetting.FullName
member.summary: Matches based on full name

member.name: T:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructor
member.summary: Class to manage settings and resources used during recursive serialization of objects

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructor.Exceptions
member.summary: Any exceptions that occured during serialization are listed here along with the Id(i) of the object that threw the error

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructor.Meta
member.summary: Contains a list of references used for rehydrating the object tree. This exists to keep the serialized (json) size as small as possible by avoiding the need for reference handling as well as avoiding struct duplication

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructor.Settings
member.summary: Contains the settings to be used when constructing the serialized object tree This is a reference so that the settings can be copied as the MetaConstructor clones itself down the tree

member.summary: Creates the default instance of the MetaConstructor

member.summary: Creates a MetaConstructor instance for a single object
member.param: The object to serialize

member.summary: Creates a MetaConstructor for an object with a declared property name, to be used in MetaSerializing a single property of an existing object
member.param: The name of the property to give
The object to serialize

member.name: M:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructor.ClaimOwnership(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the input object as the top level owner of the metadata tree
member.param: The object to set

member.summary: Clones an instance of this constructor

member.name: T:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings
member.summary: Reference class used to hold settings used during object serialization

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.AttributeBlacklist
member.summary: When using AttributeIncludeSettings.Blacklist, this list should contain a list of attribute types to skip serializing

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.AttributeIncludeSettings
member.summary: The style of setting used to determine whether or not attributes are serialized

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.AttributeMatchSettings
member.summary: Specifies the type of match to use when determining whether or not to serialize assemblies

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.AttributeWhitelist
member.summary: When using AttributeIncludeSettings.Whitelist, this list should contain a list of attribute types to serialize

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.IgnoreHiddenForeignTypes
member.summary: Ignores properties that match (!thisProperty.ReflectedType.IsVisible && thisProperty.ReflectedType.Assembly != this.Cache.CallingAssembly). Default True

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.IgnoreObjectProperties
member.summary: Ignores properties that hold "object"

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.IgnoreTypeValueProperties
member.summary: Ignores property values holding System.Type information. (default True)

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.IgnoreInheritedProperties
member.summary: Do not traverse below the top level object when serializing properties. This setting is applied recursively and should only be used when serializing DTOs

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.IgnoreNullDeclaringType
member.summary: Should ignore dynamic properties. Default True

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.IgnoreTypes
member.summary: Types to ignore while serializing. Helpful for ignoring errors. By default ignores Type and MemberInfo since in most cases those are handled seperately

member.name: M:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the constructor settings

member.name: M:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.AddTypeGetterOverride(System.Func{System.Type,System.Type})
member.summary: Function that all type resolutions pass through that can affect the return type Useful for unshelling proxy types. If multiple, they are chained, so be careful
member.param: The function that the type passes through

member.name: M:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.OverridePropertyGetter(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Overrides the method used to resolve an object property, for returning a custom type (or null to skip)
member.param: The PropertyInfo of the property to be overridden
The function to call instead of PropertyInfo.GetValue. Object in is the Parent of the property, object out is the Property Value

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.ForceSkipNameSpaces
member.summary: A list of attribute types to skip based on namespace, since not all compiler generated attributes are accessible using type

member.name: P:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Constructors.MetaConstructorSettings.ForceSkip
member.summary: A list of attribute types to skip based on name, since not all compiler generated attributes are accessible using type

The ToString value of the type
member.returns: Whether or not the types are equal

member.summary: Top level exception cache for referencing exception messages. Used because recursive serialization has the potential to generate a LOT of redundant errors

member.summary: If this object is a collection, this list contains the contents

member.summary: True if this was the object used by the original constructor

member.summary: True if the object was created using a null

member.summary: The parent property referencing this object. Unreliable in local types

member.summary: The type information for this Meta instance

member.returns: Whether or not the two objects have the same IMetaType

member.name: T:Penguin.Reflection.Serialization.Objects.StringHolder
member.summary: Converts a string into a MetaType so that it can be cached by a constructor and rehydrated later. Removes a lot of redundancy on large recursive trees
